details: Income support to all landholding farmers' families to supplement their financial needs for procuring various inputs and other needs related to agriculture and allied activities as well as domestic needs.
benefits: ₹6000 per year in three equal installments of ₹2000 each; Direct Benefit Transfer to farmer's bank account
eligibility: All landholding farmers' families irrespective of the size of their land holdings; Exclusion categories include institutional land holders, farmer families with one or more members who are income tax payees, government employees, pensioners
application:
1. Self-registration on PM-KISAN Portal (https://pmkisan.gov.in)
2. Fill in Aadhaar number, bank account details
3. Verify land records
4. Submit application
5. Track status online
documents: Aadhaar card; Land ownership documents; Bank account details with IFSC code; Mobile number linked to Aadhaar

scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
details: World's largest health insurance scheme providing coverage of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.
benefits: Health cover of Rs. 5 lakh per family per year; Cashless treatment at empanelled hospitals; Coverage for pre and post-hospitalization expenses; No restrictions on family size, age or gender
eligibility: Households identified as per SECC 2011 database; Rural: Families with only one room, kutcha walls/roof, no adult member 16-59 years, female headed households, disabled member, SC/ST households, landless households with casual labor; Urban: Rag pickers, beggars, domestic workers, street vendors, construction workers, etc.
application:
1. Check eligibility at https://pmjay.gov.in
2. Get Ayushman Card from nearest Ayushman Mitra
3. Visit any empanelled hospital with Ayushman Card
4. Hospital verifies eligibility and provides cashless treatment
documents: Aadhaar card; Ration card; Proof of residence; Mobile number; Family details

details: Government savings scheme for girl child with attractive interest rates and tax benefits under Section 80C.
benefits: High interest rate (currently 8%+ p.a.); Tax exemption on deposits, interest earned and maturity amount (EEE category); Minimum deposit ₹250, maximum ₹1.5 lakh per year
eligibility: Account can be opened in the name of a girl child from birth till she attains the age of 10 years; Only two accounts permitted per family (three in case of twins/triplets); Guardian must be a parent or legal guardian

scheme_name:
1. Visit nearest Post Office or authorized bank
2. Fill account opening form
3. Submit documents and initial deposit (minimum ₹250)
4. Deposit annually till 15 years
5. Partial withdrawal allowed after girl turns 18
6. Full maturity after 21 years
slug: Birth certificate of girl child; Identity proof of guardian (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport); Address proof of guardian; Passport size photos

details: Pension scheme for unorganized sector workers providing guaranteed minimum pension after 60 years of age.
benefits: Guaranteed monthly pension of ₹1000 to ₹5000 depending on contribution; Pension to spouse after subscriber's death; Return of corpus to nominee after death of both subscriber and spouse; Government co-contribution for eligible subscribers
eligibility: Indian citizen aged 18-40 years; Should not be covered under any statutory social security scheme; Should not be an income tax payer; Must have savings bank account or post office savings account
application:
1. Visit any bank or post office where you have account
2. Fill APY registration form
3. Provide Aadhaar and bank account details
4. Choose pension amount (₹1000-₹5000)
5. Authorize auto-debit for monthly/quarterly contributions
documents: Aadhaar card; Bank account details; Mobile number; Nominee details; Age proof

details: Housing for All scheme providing financial assistance for construction/purchase of house to urban poor.
benefits: Interest subsidy on home loans; Subsidy up to ₹2.67 lakh for EWS/LIG categories; Direct assistance for house construction; Affordable housing in partnership with private developers
eligibility: EWS (Annual income up to ₹3 lakh); LIG (Annual income ₹3-6 lakh); MIG-I (Annual income ₹6-12 lakh); MIG-II (Annual income ₹12-18 lakh); Family should not own pucca house anywhere in India; First-time home buyer
application:
1. Register on PMAY portal (https://pmaymis.gov.in)
2. Fill online application with personal and income details
3. Upload required documents
4. Submit application
5. Track application status
6. Upon approval, avail subsidy through lending institution
documents: Aadhaar card; Income certificate; Property documents; Bank account details; Caste certificate (if applicable); Self-declaration of not owning house
